title: World Desserts Quiz
description: Satisfy your sweet tooth with this quiz about famous desserts from around the globe!

questions.question: Tiramisu, meaning 'pick me up,' is a coffee-flavored dessert from which country?
Baklava is a sweet pastry made with layers of phyllo dough, nuts, and syrup. It is popular in which regions?
Crème brûlée is a French dessert distinguished by its topping of what?
Mochi is a chewy Japanese dessert made from which ingredient?
Which Austrian dessert is a rich chocolate cake with a thin layer of apricot jam?
Churros, fried dough pastries often dipped in chocolate, are a traditional treat from which country?
Which Indian dessert consists of fried dough balls soaked in sugar syrup?
Pavlova, a meringue-based dessert topped with fruit and cream, is claimed by which two countries?
Which Turkish dessert features thin strands of spun sugar wrapped around fillings like pistachios?
Flan (crème caramel) is a custard dessert especially popular in which cuisines?
Which French dessert features choux pastry puffs stacked into a cone shape, held together with caramel?
Tres leches cake, soaked in three types of milk, is a beloved dessert in which region?
Which Portuguese dessert is a small custard tart with a flaky crust, called pastel de nata?
Kanelbullar (cinnamon buns) are a beloved pastry tradition in which country?
Which classic British dessert features sponge cake, custard, fruit, jelly, and whipped cream layered in a glass bowl?
